solution_line_template: She orders {num_sandwiches} sandwiches that are ${sandwich_price} so they cost {num_sandwiches}*${sandwich_price} = $<<{num_sandwiches}*{sandwich_price}={sandwiches_total}>>{sandwiches_total}
The brie is three times more expensive than the ${salami_price} salami so the brie costs {brie_multiplier}*${salami_price} = $<<{brie_multiplier}*{salami_price}={brie_price}>>{brie_price}

She buys {olives_weight} pound of the olives that costs ${olives_price_per_pound} a pound so they cost .25*${olives_price_per_pound} =$<<{olives_weight}*{olives_price_per_pound}={olives_total}>>{olives_total}
She buys {feta_weight} pound of feta that costs ${feta_price_per_pound} a pound so it costs .5*${feta_price_per_pound} = $<<{feta_weight}*{feta_price_per_pound}={feta_total}>>{feta_total}

The salami is ${salami_price}, the brie is ${brie_price}, olives are ${olives_total} and the feta is ${feta_total} and the sandwiches are ${sandwiches_total} for a total of ${salami_price}+${brie_price}+${olives_total}+${feta_total}+${sandwiches_total} = $<<{salami_price}+{brie_price}+{olives_total}+{feta_total}+{sandwiches_total}={total_without_bread}>>{total_without_bread}
